headline.main: Rocket Hits Mosque in Eastern Afghanistan, Six Killed
headline.print_headline: Rocket Hits Mosque in Eastern Afghanistan, Six Killed

docs.snippet: A rocket apparently fired by fighters from the radical Islamic State movement has hit a mosque in eastern Afghanistan, killing six worshippers and wounding four others, a local official said on Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A rocket apparently fired by fighters from the radical Islamic State movement has hit a mosque in eastern Afghanistan, killing six worshippers and wounding four others, a local official said on Saturday.

headline.main: 5 Things to Know About Turkey's Nov. 1 Election
headline.print_headline: 5 Things to Know About Turkey's Nov. 1 Election

docs.snippet: Turkey will hold a parliamentary election Sunday for the second time since June. Here are five things to know about the vote:...
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey will hold a parliamentary election Sunday for the second time since June. Here are five things to know about the vote:

docs.snippet: American Express is one of a growing number of companies that include arbitration clauses in their consumer contracts. The section on arbitration can be found toward the end of the contract, which contains several thousand words of legal language....
docs.lead_paragraph: American Express is one of a growing number of companies that include arbitration clauses in their consumer contracts. The section on arbitration can be found toward the end of the contract, which contains several thousand words of legal language.

headline.main: Greek Banks' Non Performing Loans Total 107 Billion Euros
headline.print_headline: Greek Banks' Non Performing Loans Total 107 Billion Euros

docs.snippet: Non-performing loans at National Bank of Greece, Piraeus Bank, Alpha Bank and Eurobank total 107 billion euros, a European Central Bank official said on Saturday, commenting on the results of the ECB's assessment of Greece's four largest banks on ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Non-performing loans at National Bank of Greece, Piraeus Bank, Alpha Bank and Eurobank total 107 billion euros, a European Central Bank official said on Saturday, commenting on the results of the ECB's assessment of Greece's four largest banks on a conference call.

headline.main: With Anti-Trade Message, Trump Targets 'Reagan Democrats'
headline.print_headline: With Anti-Trade Message, Trump Targets 'Reagan Democrats'

docs.snippet: To hear Donald Trump tell it, blue-collar workers here are suffering as much as ever, their livelihoods endangered by the familiar combination of foreign competition and U.S. companies eager to hold down labor costs....
docs.lead_paragraph: To hear Donald Trump tell it, blue-collar workers here are suffering as much as ever, their livelihoods endangered by the familiar combination of foreign competition and U.S. companies eager to hold down labor costs.

docs.snippet: A Russian-operated Airbus A321 with 224 passengers and crew on board has crashed in the Sinai Peninsula. Paul Chapman reports....

headline.main: Swatch CEO Sees 2016 Swiss Launch for Pay Watch: Newspaper
headline.print_headline: Swatch CEO Sees 2016 Swiss Launch for Pay Watch: Newspaper

docs.snippet: Swatch Group expects to launch a smartwatch that can be used to make payments in Switzerland next spring, Chief Executive Nick Hayek said in an interview with a Swiss newspaper published on Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Swatch Group expects to launch a smartwatch that can be used to make payments in Switzerland next spring, Chief Executive Nick Hayek said in an interview with a Swiss newspaper published on Saturday.

headline.main: China Sentences 'Cult' Leader to Life in Prison Amid Crackdown: Xinhua
headline.print_headline: China Sentences 'Cult' Leader to Life in Prison Amid Crackdown: Xinhua

docs.snippet: China has sentenced the head of what it calls a cult to life in prison on charges including rape and fraud, state news agency Xinhua said on Saturday, continuing a crackdown on what it views as dangerous illegal movements....
docs.lead_paragraph: China has sentenced the head of what it calls a cult to life in prison on charges including rape and fraud, state news agency Xinhua said on Saturday, continuing a crackdown on what it views as dangerous illegal movements.

headline.main: Syrian MP: US Decision to Send Troops Is Act of Aggression
headline.print_headline: Syrian MP: US Decision to Send Troops Is Act of Aggression

docs.snippet: The United States' decision to send troops into Syria is an act of aggression because it does not have the government's agreement, a Syrian member of parliament said Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States' decision to send troops into Syria is an act of aggression because it does not have the government's agreement, a Syrian member of parliament said Saturday.

headline.main: Publisher of Secular Books Killed, 3 Wounded in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: Publisher of Secular Books Killed, 3 Wounded in Bangladesh

docs.snippet: A publisher of secular books was hacked to death and three other people wounded in fresh attacks in Bangladesh's capital that were claimed by Muslim radicals, and a human rights group called on the government to urgently protect freedom of express...
docs.lead_paragraph: A publisher of secular books was hacked to death and three other people wounded in fresh attacks in Bangladesh's capital that were claimed by Muslim radicals, and a human rights group called on the government to urgently protect freedom of expression.
